Package gui

Class Images

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Images

  • public class Images
extends java.lang.Object
    Images class which represents the manager and database for images. Additionally provides a utility to draw text to the screen and load fonts.
    Version:
    May 26, 2020
    Author:
    Jeffrey Lee, Raeed Azom, Period: 1, Assignment: APCS Final Project, Sources: none

      • combine

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon combine​(javax.swing.ImageIcon bottom,
                                            javax.swing.ImageIcon top)
        Combines and returns two images, the bottom image and the top image
        Parameters:
        bottom - - the image that will be combined to the top but placed at the bottom
        top - - the image that will be combined to the bottom but placed at the top
        Returns:
        new ImageIcon - the image of the combined top and bottom images

      • combine

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon combine​(javax.swing.ImageIcon bottom,
                                            javax.swing.ImageIcon top,
                                            int offx,
                                            int offy)
        Combines and returns two images, the bottom and the top image, additionally set according to the offset of the x and y values
        Parameters:
        bottom - - the image that will be combined to the top but placed at the bottom
        top - - the image that will be combined to the bottom but placed at the top
        offx - - the offset of the x value of the position
        offy - - the offset of the y value of the position
        Returns:
        new ImageIcon - the image of the combined top and bottom images set according to the offest of the x and y values

        Parameters:

        newW - - new given width
        newH - - new given height
        Returns:
        new ImageIcon - resized image accordingly to the given width and height

      • crop

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage crop​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                int x,
                                                int y,
                                                int width,
                                                int height)
        Crops a given image accordingly to the given width and height starting at the position with the given x and y values
        Parameters:
        img - - given image to crop
        x - - given x position to crop from
        y - - given y position to crop from
        width - - given width to crop
        height - - given height to crop
        Returns:
        new BufferedImage - the cropped image given the position and width and height

      • drawText

        public static void drawText​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int xPos,
                            int yPos,
                            boolean center,
                            java.awt.Color color,
                            java.awt.Font font)
        Draws a string to the screen with the given text, position, color, font, and whether the placement for the position is at the text's center
        Parameters:
        g - - Graphics tool
        text - - text to draw to the screen
        xPos - - x position to draw the text
        yPos - - y position to draw the text
        center - - true if the desired placement at the position is the center of the string, false if otherwise
        color - - the color of the text
        font - - the font of the text
